Package Utils

Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Utils.Validator
  • public class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be used to validate values It contains two methods which will be called to validate the value in a specific case

    • Method Detail

      • verifyInt

        public boolean verifyInt​(java.lang.String numberInString)
        Method to verify an int value introduced by the user. It will verify if the value introduced by the user can be parsed in an int with a try and catch.
        Parameters:
        numberInString - is a String introduced by the user which will be verified if it's a number.
        Returns:
        true if the String can be parsed in an int value and false if not.

      • verifyQuantity

        public boolean verifyQuantity​(int quantity)
        this method verifies that the number of passengers entering is no more than 5.
        Parameters:
        quantity - total passangers
        Returns:
        a signal that indicates whether or not the 5 passengers pass or not

      • verifyName

        public boolean verifyName​(java.lang.String name)
        This method helps to validate the user's response. Helps to validate if the user did not enter a strange character or number.
        Parameters:
        name - Name entered by the user.
        Returns:
        true in case everything is correct and false when you enter a rare character or number.

      • verifyLocation

        public boolean verifyLocation​(java.lang.String location)
        This method helps to validate the user's response. Helps to validate that the user has not entered any strange characters when entering their location.
        Parameters:
        location - The location entered by the user.
        Returns:
        true when the rule is satisfied and false when it has strange characters.

      • validateTwoStrings

        public boolean validateTwoStrings​(java.lang.String correctAnswer1,
                                  java.lang.String correctAnswer2,
                                  java.lang.String answer)
        Method to validate if a string is equals to one of the required answers. It will validate if the user answer is one of the two required answers.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswer1 - the first correct option.
        correctAnswer2 - the second correct option.
        answer - the value introduced by the user.
        Returns:
        true if the user answer is equals to one of the two options.
